intro: Hieraciodes dioritica, commonly known as the diorite hieracium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are generally narrow and hairy, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. The flowers are usually yellow or white, blooming in late summer and attracting various pollinators.
